data.name: Close_Description
data.value: Close a previously launched Outlook instance

data.name: Close_Instance_Description
data.value: The Outlook instance to work with. This variable is specified in a 'Launch Outlook' action

data.name: Close_Summary
data.value: Close the Outlook instance stored into <INSTANCE>

data.name: DeleteEmails_Description
data.value: Delete an email message (or a list of email messages) retrieved by a 'Retrieve email messages from Outlook' action

data.name: Error_AttachmentNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the specified attachment(s) don't exist

data.name: Error_CloseOutlookError_Description
data.value: Indicates a problem closing the Outlook instance

data.name: Error_DirectoryNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the specified email message(s) couldn't be saved because the directory doesn't exist

data.name: Error_InvalidMailFolderError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the specified mail folder isn't valid

data.name: Error_InvalidMailFolderError_FriendlyName
data.value: Mail folder specified not valid in Outlook

data.name: Error_MailFolderNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the specified mail folder doesn't exist

data.name: Error_MessageDeletedOrMovedError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the specified email message(s) couldn't be saved because they are moved or deleted

data.name: Error_MessageDeletedOrMovedError_FriendlyName
data.value: Email message is deleted or moved to another folder

data.name: Error_OutlookAccountNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the specified Outlook account doesn't exist

data.name: Error_ProcessEmailMessagesError_Description
data.value: Indicates a problem processing the specified email messages in Outlook

data.name: Error_ProcessEmailMessagesError_FriendlyName
data.value: Failed to process email messages in Outlook

data.name: Error_RetrieveEmailMessagesError_Description
data.value: Indicates a problem retrieving the email messages from Outlook

data.name: Error_RetrieveEmailMessagesError_FriendlyName
data.value: Failed to retrieve email messages from Outlook

data.name: Error_SaveAttachmentsDirectoryNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the directory to save the attachments into doesn't exist

data.name: Error_SaveAttachmentsDirectoryNotFoundError_FriendlyName
data.value: Directory for saving attachments not found

data.name: Error_SaveEmailMessagesError_Description
data.value: Indicates a problem saving the specified email message(s)

data.name: Error_SendEmailMessageError_Description
data.value: Indicates a problem sending the email message

data.name: ForwardEmail_Description
data.value: Respond to an Outlook message by forwarding it

data.name: ForwardEmail_Summary
data.value: Respond to a received message by forwarding to <SENDTO>

data.name: Launch_Description
data.value: Launch Outlook and create a new Outlook instance

data.name: Launch_Instance_Description
data.value: The specific Outlook instance for use with later Outlook actions

data.name: Launch_Summary
data.value: <if(INSTANCE)>Launch Outlook and store the instance created in <INSTANCE><else> Launch Outlook <endif>

data.name: MarkEmailsAsUnread_Description
data.value: Mark an email message (or a list of email messages) retrieved by a 'Retrieve email messages from Outlook' action as unread

data.name: MarkEmailsAsUnread_Summary
data.value: Mark email messages <EMAILSTOPROCESS> from account <ACCOUNT> as unread

data.name: MoveEmails_Description
data.value: Move an email message (or a list of email messages) retrieved by a 'Retrieve emails from Outlook' action

data.name: MoveEmails_Summary
data.value: Move email messages <EMAILSTOPROCESS> to mail folder <FOLDER> in account <ACCOUNT>

data.name: Outlook_Description
data.value: Automate sending, receiving, and managing email messages of an Outlook account

data.name: ProcessEmailMessages_Account_Description
data.value: The name of the Outlook account (data file name) to work with

data.name: ProcessEmailMessages_Description
data.value: Move or delete an email message (or a list of email messages) retrieved by a 'Retrieve email messages from Outlook' action.

data.name: ProcessEmailMessages_EmailsToProcess_Description
data.value: The email message(s) to process. Use a variable populated by a 'Retrieve email messages from Outlook' action

data.name: ProcessEmailMessages_Instance_Description
data.value: The Outlook instance to work with. Specify this variable in a 'Launch Outlook' action

data.name: ProcessEmailMessages_MailFolder_Description
data.value: The name of the folder to retrieve messages from. Enter the full folder path for subfolders (e.g., Inbox\Work)

data.name: ProcessEmailMessages_Operation_Description
data.value: Specifies which operation to perform on the specified email messages

data.name: ProcessEmailOperation_Move_FriendlyName
data.value: Move email messages to mail folder

data.name: ReplyAllToEmail_Description
data.value: Respond to an Outlook message by replying to all

data.name: ReplyAllToEmail_Summary
data.value: Respond to a received message by replying to all

data.name: ReplyToEmail_Description
data.value: Respond to an Outlook message by replying

data.name: ReplyToEmail_Summary
data.value: Respond to a received message by replying

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_Account_Description
data.value: The name of the Outlook account (data file name) to work with

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_Attachments_Description
data.value: The full path of any attachment(s). Enclose multiple files in double quotes (") and separate them by a space character

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_BCC_Description
data.value: The email address(es) of the BCC (hidden) recipient(s). To enter more than one email address, separate the list of addresses by spaces or semicolons

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_CC_Description
data.value: The email address(es) of the CC recipient(s). To enter more than one email address, separate the list of addresses by spaces or semicolons

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_Description
data.value: Respond to an Outlook message, by replying, replying to all or forwarding it

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_Instance_Description
data.value: The Outlook instance to work with. Specify this variable in a 'Launch Outlook' action

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_MailMessage_Description
data.value: The email message to act upon. Use a variable populated by a 'Retrieve email messages from Outlook' action

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_ResponseAction_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to reply (to sender or all) with a message or forward the received message

data.name: RespondToMailMessage_SendTo_Description
data.value: The email address(es) of the recipient(s). To enter more than one email address, separate the list of addresses by spaces or semicolons

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_Account_Description
data.value: The name of the Outlook account (data file name) to work with

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_AttachmentsOptions_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to save the attachments of the email messages retrieved or not

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_BodyContains_Description
data.value: The key phrase to find within the email body. Leave this attribute blank to retrieve all email messages regardless of their content

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_Description
data.value: Retrieve email messages from an Outlook account

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_EmailsToRetrieve_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to retrieve all messages in the folder or only the unread ones

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_FromContains_Description
data.value: The full email address of the sender whose messages to retrieve. Leave this attribute blank to retrieve all messages regardless of the sender

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_Instance_Description
data.value: The Outlook instance to work with. Specify this variable in a 'Launch Outlook' action

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_MailFolder_Description
data.value: The name of the folder to retrieve messages from. Enter the full folder path for subfolders (ex: Inbox\Work)

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_MarkAsRead_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to mark as read all the unread messages retrieved

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_Messages_Description
data.value: The retrieved email messages for later processing. The variable contains a list of Outlook message objects

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_SaveAttachmentsInto_Description
data.value: The path to save the attachments of the retrieved emails into

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_SubjectContains_Description
data.value: The key phrase to find within the email subject. Leave this attribute blank to retrieve all email messages regardless of their subject

data.name: RetrieveEmailMessages_ToContains_Description
data.value: The full email address(es) of the recipient(s) (separated by space or semicolon if more than one) for the messages to retrieve. Leave this attribute blank to retrieve all messages regardless of the recipient(s)

data.name: RetrieveEmails_Description
data.value: Retrieve email messages from an Outlook account

data.name: RetrieveEmailsAndSaveAttachments_Description
data.value: Retrieve email messages from an Outlook account and saves their attachments

data.name: SaveEmails_Description
data.value: Save Outlook email messages given an account

data.name: SaveEmails_Summary
data.value: Save Outlook email messages from account <ACCOUNT> to folder <SAVEEMAILSTO> as <SAVEFORMAT>

data.name: SaveEmailsAs_Description
data.value: Save Outlook email messages given an account

data.name: SaveEmailsAs_Summary
data.value: Save Outlook email messages from account <ACCOUNT> to folder <SAVEEMAILSTO> with custom name <SAVEEMAILSAS> and type <SAVEFORMAT>

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_Account_Description
data.value: The name of the Outlook account (data file name) to work with

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_Description
data.value: Save Outlook email messages given an account

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_EmailsToSave_Description
data.value: The email message(s) to save. Use a variable populated by a 'Retrieve email messages from Outlook' action

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_Instance_Description
data.value: The Outlook instance to work with. Specify this variable in a 'Launch Outlook' action

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_MessagesFiles_Description
data.value: The file paths of the saved email messages for later processing

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_SaveAsMode_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to save the messages using the default name (subject) or provide another

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_SaveEmailsAs_Description
data.value: Specifies the custom name for messages' name which differs from message to message by an automatically added suffix

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_SaveEmailsTo_Description
data.value: The folder to save the messages to

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_SaveFormat_Description
data.value: Specifies the format to save the messages

data.name: SaveOutlookEmailMessages_Summary
data.value: Save Outlook email messages from account <ACCOUNT> to folder as <SAVEFORMAT>

data.name: SendEmail_Description
data.value: Create and send a new email message through Outlook

data.name: SendEmailFromMailbox_Description
data.value: Create and send a new email message through Outlook from another mailbox

data.name: SendEmailFromMailbox_Summary
data.value: Send email to <SENDTO> from mailbox <SENDFROM> with subject <SUBJECT>

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_Account_Description
data.value: The name of the Outlook account (data file name) to work with

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_Attachments_Description
data.value: The full path of any attachment(s). Enclose multiple files in double quotes (") and separate them by a space character

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_BCC_Description
data.value: The email address(es) of the BCC (hidden) recipient(s). To enter more than one email address, separate the list of addresses by spaces or semicolons

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_CC_Description
data.value: The email address(es) of the CC recipient(s). To enter more than one email address, separate the list of addresses by spaces or semicolons

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_Description
data.value: Create and send a new email message through Outlook

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_Instance_Description
data.value: The Outlook instance to work with. Specify this variable in a 'Launch Outlook' action

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_IsBodyHtml_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to interpret the body of the email as HTML coding

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_SendEmailFrom_Description
data.value: Specifies whether to send the email message using the specified account or a different one, for example from a shared mailbox

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_SendFrom_Description
data.value: The name of the Outlook account to send the email from; for example, a shared mailbox.

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_SendTo_Description
data.value: The email address(es) of the recipient(s). To enter more than one email address, separate the list of addresses by spaces or semicolons

data.name: SendEmailThroughOutlook_Subject_Description
data.value: The subject of the email message

data.name: OutlookMailMessage_OutlookMailmessage
data.value: Outlook email message from {0} with subject {1}

data.name: ErrorMessage_UninitializedOutlookInstance
data.value: Outlook instance is uninitialized. Please double-check that the correct Outlook instance has been specified and that it's used after a 'Launch Outlook' and not after the Outlook instance has been closed

data.name: ErrorMessage_MailFolderDoesNotExist
data.value: Mail folder {0} doesn't exist in Outlook

data.name: ErrorMessage_MailFolderNotFound
data.value: Failed to find mail folder {0} in Outlook

data.name: ErrorMessage_DirectoryToSaveAttachmentNotFound
data.value: Directory {0} for saving attachments not found

data.name: ErrorMessage_FailedToRetrieveEmails
data.value: Failed to retrieve email messages from Outlook

data.name: ErrorMessage_EmailNotFound
data.value: Email message is deleted or moved to another folder (EntryID: {0})
